title: Lag
body:
Hello,
I feel as if every time you guys bring out an update I swear the game lags like hell and then a day or two later it's gone?. I know it's not my computer as I have good specs plus  a decent net. I also don't lag during the week when they're no updates. I seem to be lagging after you guys have released an update. A couple of my friends have the same problem. Just thought you guys should know in case other people have this problem.  

Thanks, 
Jaffa

replies.body: I've been reporting it for months and get ignored. Finally its happening to other people. Except for me its not around the patch releases its when ever I dominate then I get really low fps and normal ping 20-10 fps with NVidia 660+ 2gram p7 64bit 3.4mzh. If I don't dominate and just hang back no lag. I think people know how to lag the server when they are losing.

Same here!

Mine sits around 40~ for about half a minute then spikes up to 60, sometimes as high as 180, before going back to 40. It does this constantly, getting higher as the match progresses.

What's worse is that sometimes I lose control of my champ altogether while it comes up with "attempting to reconnect", and by the time I get control back I'm usually feeding, executed or sitting on my ass while the rest of the team does a 4v5.

Like you said, this always seems to happen when a new patch gets rolled out, then it (sometimes) aleviates further into the week. It's really annoying! D:

Edit: I'd also like to mention it doesn't happen on NA.
Are you playing the game right as the patch is released?

Try this guys, I did this and mine is fixed. Let me know if it helps - Jaffa 

Hello I know how annoying lag is and I have been lagging lately. I have good net and specs etc here is how I fixed it or at least got it to playable.

Settings: Custom
Resolution: Match desktop resolution
Character Quality: Very Low
Environment Quality: Very Low
Shadows: No Shadow
Effects Quality: Very Low
Frame Rate Cap: 60 FPS
Wait for Vertical Sync: Unchecked
Anti-Aliasing: Unchecked

For the character and environment quality you can have low instead of very low, just try different things.

This is what work for me especially these two things:
Wait for Vertical Sync: Unchecked
Anti-Aliasing: Unchecked

Hope this heaps!

-Jaffa
That's a solution, but we shouldn't have to be lowering our settings to keep our frame-rate higher after a patch. There is a problem with the game.
I had stable ping up until a week ago, it will now spike to 300+ making the game rather hard to play.
